author-notes.corresp: Address correspondence to Zabrina L. Brumme, zbrumme@sfu.ca, or Gustavo Reyes-Teran, gustavo.reyesteran@gmail.com.

fn.p: Present address: Thalía Garcia-Tellez, Institut Pasteur, Unité HIV, Inflammation and Persistence, Paris, France.
M.S.N. and S.A.R. contributed equally to this work.

Citation Soto-Nava M, Avila-Ríos S, Valenzuela-Ponce H, García-Morales C, Carlson JM, Tapia-Trejo D, Garrido-Rodriguez D, Alva-Hernández SN, García-Tellez TA, Murakami-Ogasawara A, the International HIV Adaptation Collaborative, Mallal SA, John M, Brockman MA, Brumme CJ, Brumme ZL, Reyes-Teran G, and the HIV MexNet Group. 2018. Weaker HLA footprints on HIV in the unique and highly genetically admixed host population of Mexico. J Virol 92:e01128-17. https://doi.org/10.1128/JVI.01128-17.
